Line Description: Downtown LA - Westwood via Sunset Bl
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: Downtown LA - Santa Monica via Santa Monica Bl
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: West Hollywood - Downtown LA via Melrose Av
Details: No route changes. Overnight owl service discontinued due to low ridership. Bus stop consolidation.

Line Description: Beverly Center - Downtown LA via Beverly Bl
Details: No route changes to Line 14 between downtown LA and Beverly/San Vicente via Beverly Bl. New Line 617 provides service west of Beverly/San Vicente to Pico Bl via Beverly Dr. Bus stop consolidation.

Line Description: Downtown LA - West Hollywood via West 3rd St
Details:
Lines 16 and 17 merge to become the new Line 16, which operates via Line 16/17 normal route between downtown LA and 3rd St/San Vicente via 3rd St, then north on San Vicente to Santa Monica Bl. 
Line 16 west of 3rd St/San Vicente on Burton Way in Beverly Hills is replaced by new Line 617, which operates from E Line (Expo) Culver City Station to Cedars-Sinai Medical Center/Beverly Center via Robertson Bl, then west on Burton Way and Beverly Dr to Pico Bl. This includes new weekend service for Robertson Bl. Bus stop consolidation.

Line Description: Wilshire Western Station - Montebello Metrolink Station via 6th St & Whittier Bl
Details: Increased Line 18 service east of downtown LA to East LA/Commerce Center via Whittier Bl replaces Line 720 east of downtown LA. No route changes to Line 18 between Montebello/Commerce Metrolink station. Bus stop consolidation.

Line Description: Downtown LA - Westwood/Santa Monica via Wilshire Bl
Details: To serve more stops in downtown LA, Line 20 westbound rerouted via Wall St, right 7th St, right Los Angeles St, left 5th St then operates via normal route. No changes to eastbound route.

Line Description: Century City - Downtown LA via Olympic Bl
Details: Line 28 operates via normal route between Century City and downtown LA, terminating at Cesar Chavez/Vignes via Olympic Bl. Line 45 continues to serve the discontinued section of Line 28 on Broadway between downtown LA (Cesar Chavez Av) and Ave 26. Line 251 will extend trips every 30 min. weekdays and weekends to link Broadway, L Line(Gold) Lincoln/Cypress Station and Eagle Rock via existing Line 28 route on Eagle Rock Bl.

Line Description: West Hollywood - Downtown LA - Indiana Station via Pico Bl & 1st St
Details:
Line 30 operates via existing route between Pico Rimpau Transit Center and 1st St in downtown LA, with trips ending at either Union Station or continuing east to Indiana Station via normal route. 
Line 30 service is discontinued on San Vicente Av between West Hollywood and Pico Rimpau Transit Center; Various high frequency north-south (204, 207, 210) or east-west lines (4, 14, 16, 20, 28, 720) are available as alternative services for riders.

Line Description: Downtown LA - Santa Monica via Venice Bl
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: Downtown LA - Washington/Fairfax via Washington Bl (Line 35)/Jefferson Bl (Line 38)
Details: No route changes. Bus stop consolidation.

Line Description: Downtown LA - Washington/Fairfax via Adams Bl
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: Downtown LA - South Bay Galleria via ML King Bl-Hawthorne Bl
Details: Line 40 route change in downtown LA to travel via Los Angeles St between Alameda St and 1st St to avoid Regional Connector construction.

Line Description: Lincoln Heights - Downtown LA - Harbor Freeway Station via Broadway
Details: Line 45 is altered to follow existing route between C Line (Green)/J Line (Silver) Harbor Freeway Station, downtown LA and Lincoln Heights via Broadway. Line 127 extends from A Line (Blue) Compton Station to replace Line 45 segment south of Harbor Freeway Station (Figueroa/117th St) via Imperial Hwy, Broadway, El Segundo Bl, Main St, Rosecrans Av, Avalon Bl, and Compton Bl.

Line Description: Downtown LA - Avalon Station via Main St
Details: No route changes. Bus stop consolidation.

Line Description: Wilshire Center - Downtown LA - CSU University Dominguez Hills via 7th St & Avalon Bl
Details: Lines 51 and 52 merge to become the new Line 51, which operates from Wilshire/Vermont via the existing route on 7th St to downtown LA and San Pedro St and Avalon Bl to the C Line (Green) Avalon Station, with some bus stop consolidation. Selected Line 51 trips extend south on Avalon Bl to terminate at Victoria St/Tamcliff Av at Cal State Dominguez Hills campus, traveling north via right Central Av, right University Dr, right Avalon Bl. An extension of Line 127 replaces Line 51 on Compton Bl and provides a new link to the J Line (Silver)/C Line Harbor Freeway Station, replacing Line 52 trips to Harbor Gateway Transit Center.

Line Description: Downtown LA - CSU Dominguez Hills via Central Av
Details: No route changes. Bus stop consolidation.

Line Description: Downtown LA - Willowbrook Station via Compton Av
Details: No route changes. Bus stop consolidation.

Line Description: Downtown LA - Artesia Station via Long Beach Bl
Details: Line 60 route change in downtown LA to provide more service for the east end of 7th St. Line 60 rerouted to operate both directions via Los Angeles and 7th Sts between 5th/6th Sts and Central Av.

Line Description: Downtown LA - Hawaiian Gardens via Telegraph Rd
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: Wilshire Center - Downtown LA - Montebello via 8th St - Olympic Bl
Details: Line 66 will be altered to operate the existing alignment between Wilshire/Western Station and Montebello/Commerce Metrolink Station via Western Av, 8th St, and Olympic Bl/8th St. Line 66 eastern terminus for every other trip daytime and all trips all week after 8 p.m. will be Commerce Center, routed eastbound via Olympic Bl, left Goodrich St, returning westbound via right Whittier Bl, right Gerhart St, right Olympic Bl.

Line Description: Downtown LA - The Shops at Montebello via Cesar Chavez Av
Details: Line 68 is discontinued. Service along Cesar Chavez Av is replaced by a more frequent Line 70.  Service east of Atlantic Bl to the Shops of Montebello is replaced by Line 106 extension.

Line Description: Downtown LA - El Monte via Cesar Chavez Av/Atlantic Bl/Garvey Av
Details: Line 70 merges with Lines 68 and 770 to become the new Line 70, with more frequency and overnight Owl service, operating via Line 770 routing between downtown LA and El Monte Station via Cesar Chavez Av, Atlantic Bl, and Garvey Av. Lines 68 and 770 are discontinued. Line 70 segment from CSULA to Garvey/ Atlantic replaced by extension of Line 106.

Line Description: Downtown LA - CSU LA - LAC+USC Med Center
Details: Line 71 is discontinued. Service from Marengo St/State St is replaced by Line 106 extension to CSU Los Angeles Transit Center. Lines 78/79 provide alternate service to downtown LA from Mission Rd/Marengo St.

Line Description: Downtown LA - El Monte via Valley Bl
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: Downtown LA - Arcadia via Las Tunas/Huntington Drs
Details: Line 78 east end will terminate at Live Oak Av/Santa Anita Av. Foothill Transit 492 provides alternative service on Live Oak Av east of Santa Anita Av.

Line Description: Eagle Rock - Downtown LA - Harbor Freeway Station via Figueroa St
Details: Line 81 route remains the same south of Figueroa St and Yosemite Dr via Figueroa St to downtown LA and the J Line (Silver)/C Line (Green) Harbor Freeway Station. Line 81 replaces Line 181 in Eagle Rock with a change in route via Yosemite St to Colorado Bl/Eagledale. Other trips will continue to end at Figueroa/Colorado. Line 81 overnight Owl service replaces Line 83 Owl service from downtown LA to Figueroa/Colorado and connects to Line 180 Owl.

Line Description: Downtown LA - Eagle Rock via  York Bl
Details: Line 83 is discontinued. Line 182 replaces Line 83 service on York Bl between Figueroa St and Eagle Rock Bl. Line 81 and the L Line (Gold) provide alternative service from downtown LA to Highland Park. In addition, Metro Micro (transit on-demand) will also be implemented in the Highland Park/Eagle Rock area.

Line Description: LA Civic Center - Sunland - North Hollywood via Glendale Av-Foothill Bl-Vineland Av
Details: Lines 90 and 91 merge to become the new Line 90 between downtown LA (1st St) and Sunland, then extend via Vineland Av to B Line (Red) North Hollywood Station. New Line 690 operates between Sunland and Olive View Medical Center via Foothill Bl, continuing to Sylmar/San Fernando Metrolink Station replacing a segment of Line 224. Service on Honolulu St in Glendale/La Crescenta is discontinued due to low ridership. Frequent Line 94 continues to serve downtown LA (Hill St) south of 1st St in place of Lines 90 and 91.

Line Description: Downtown LA - Sylmar Station via Glendale-Glenoaks Bl
Details: No route changes. Bus stop consolidation.

Line Description: Downtown LA - Glendale - Burbank - North Hollywood via San Fernando Rd and Magnolia Bl
Details: Lines 94 and 794 merge to become more frequent Line 94 to operate on San Fernando Rd via most of the existing Line 94 route between downtown LA and downtown Burbank. Bus stop consolidation. A change in route operated by Line 94 will be through downtown Glendale via Brand Bl and Broadway (instead of direct via San Fernando Rd). Line 94 adds a new extension via Magnolia Bl between Burbank and B Line (Red) North Hollywood Station, replacing a segment of Line 183. New Line 294 operates on San Fernando Rd between Sylmar San Fernando Metrolink Station and downtown Burbank in place of Lines 94 and 794.

Line Description: Chinatown - Burbank Station via Griffith Park Dr
Details: Line 96 operates via normal route between downtown Burbank, LA Zoo, Elysian Valley (Riverside Dr) and Chinatown, terminating at Main and Alameda. Line 94 provides service on Hill St for travel further into downtown LA.

Line Description: LAX City Bus Center - South Gate via La Tijera-Exposition Blvds
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: West Hollywood - Vernon via La Cienega Bl/Vernon Av
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: Atlantic/Garvey- Cal State LA - LAC USC Medical Center- ELAC-Shops at Montebello
Details: Line 106 is extended from Atlantic/Cesar Chavez to The Shops at Montebello via the existing Line 68 route. Line 106 also extends from State St and Marengo St via Line 71 route, and then extends via the existing Line 70 route to Garvey Av and Atlantic Bl. Line 106 route is also changed to provide direct service to the L Line (Gold) Atlantic Station then travel direct via 1st St to State St instead of traveling via Indiana St, 3rd St, 4th St, Soto St, Whittier Bl, and Boyle Av. Line 106 operates new weekend and more frequent weekday service.

Line Description: Marina Del Rey - Pico Rivera via Slauson Av
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: Playa Vista - Bell Gardens via Jefferson Bl-Gage Av
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: LAX City Bus Center - Norwalk Station via Florence Av
Details: Line 111 more trips weekdays will be extended further west to terminate at Inglewood Transit Center. Bus stop consolidation.

Line Description: Playa Del Rey - Norwalk via Manchester Av - Firestone Bl
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: LAX City Bus Center - Downey via Century Bl-Imperial Hwy
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: Aviation/LAX Station - Whittwood Center via Imperial Hwy
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: El Segundo - Norwalk Station via Rosecrans Av
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: Compton Station - Downey via Compton-Somerset Bl
Details: Line 127 operates via normal route between Downey Depot and A Line (Blue) Compton Station, then extends west of A Line Compton Station to J Line (Silver)/C Line (Green) Harbor Freeway Station via Compton Bl, Avalon Bl, Rosecrans Av, Main St, El Segundo Bl, Broadway, and Imperial Hwy to Figueroa/117th St, replacing segments of Lines 45 and 51. New weekend and more frequent weekday service.

Line Description: Compton Station - Cerritos Towne Center via Alondra Bl
Details: No route changes. New weekend service.

Line Description: Redondo Beach - Los Cerritos Center via Artesia Bl
Details: Line 130 operates via normal route on Artesia Bl between A Line (Blue) Artesia Station and Cerritos. Torrance Transit new Line 13 replaces Line 130 west of the A Line Artesia Station, and follows thge existing Line 130 via Artesia Bl to Redondo Beach.

Line Description: Chatsworth - Canoga Park - Tarzana via Topanga Canyon Bl-Ventura Bl
Details: Lines 150, 240, 245, 744 and 750 merge to create two new lines: Line 150 operates from Ventura/Reseda west to Chatsworth Station along Ventura Bl and Topanga Canyon Bl; Line 240 operates via Reseda Bl and east along Ventura Bl between Northridge (Devonshire St), CSUN campus and B Line (Red) Universal City/Studio City Station. New Line 150 replaces Line 245 on Topanga Canyon Bl and Line 750 on Ventura Bl west of Reseda Bl. New Line 240 replaces Lines 150, 744 and 750 on Ventura Bl east of Ventura/Reseda and replaces Line 744 on Reseda Bl. Bus stop consolidation.

Line Description: Topanga Canyon Bl - North Hollywood Station via Roscoe Bl
Details: Line 152 route is changed to operate via Lankershim Bl to provide a more direct connection to the B Line (Red) North Hollywood Station, and the west end terminus is at Roscoe Bl/Topanga Canyon Bl, with connection available to G Line (Orange) and Line 150 service to Canoga Park area. Service on Vineland Ave is provided by modified Lines 90 and 162. Modified Line 162 replaces Line 152 service on Fallbrook Av.

Line Description: Sepulveda Bl - Burbank Station via Oxnard St-Burbank Bl
Details: Line 154 continues to operate via normal route between downtown Burbank, the B Line (Red) North Hollywood Station via Burbank Bl and Edison Av/Oxnard St, and west of North Hollywood Station to Sepulveda Bl. Line 154 west of Sepulveda Bl is discontinued due to low ridership; alternative service is available on Line 164 on Victory Bl and the G Line (Orange) service.

Line Description: Sherman Oaks - Burbank Station via Riverside Dr-Olive St
Details: Line 155 continues to operate via normal route between downtown Burbank, the B Line (Red) Universal City/Studio City Station, and Van Nuys Bl via Olive Av and Riverside Dr. Line 155 is extended from Van Nuys Bl via Sepulveda Bl via Magnolia Bl to the North Hollywood B Line (Red) Station, replacing Line 183 on this segment.

Line Description: Chatsworth Station - Sherman Oaks via Devonshire-Woodman
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: Thousand Oaks - Agoura Hills - Calbasas - Warner Center
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: Woodland Hills - West Hills - North Hollywood via Sherman Way-Vineland Av
Details: Lines 162 and 163 merge to become the new Line 162, with frequent service on Sherman Way. On the east end, Line 162 operates via Vineland Av to provide connection to the B Line (Red) North Hollywood Station, and will operate via Fallbrook Av at the west end of the line (replacing Line 152), and continues to directly serve West Hills Medical Center. Line 152 replaces Line 162 service on Lankershim Bl.

Line Description: West Hills - Burbank via Victory Bl
Details: No route changes. Bus stop consolidation.

Line Description: West Hills - Burbank via Vanowen St
Details: No route changes. Bus stop consolidation.

Line Description: Canoga Av - Sun Valley via Nordhoff St-Osborne St
Details: Line 166 continues to operate via Nordhoff St and Osborne St. On the west end, Line 166 terminates at Nordhoff St/Canoga Av, connecting with G Line (Orange). The segment on Topanga Canyon Bl is now served by new Line 150.

Line Description: Chatsworth Station - Studio City via Plummer-Coldwater Canyon
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: Warner Center - Burbank Airport via Valley Circle-Saticoy St
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: Silverlake - Hollywood via Hyperion-Fountain Aves
Details: Line 175 is discontinued. The Line 175 segment between John Marshall High School and Sunset/ Vermont is replaced by new Line 182, with all-day 7-day a week service to operate from Rose Hill Transit Center to B Line (Red) Vermont/Sunset Station, including Fletcher Dr, Rowena Av and Franklin St.

Line Description: Highland Park - Montebello via Mission-Tyler-Rush
Details: Line 176 is discontinued due to low ridership. Alternative service from El Monte Station to The Shops of Montebello is provided by the new Line 287 via the existing Line 176 route. Alternative services in the area between El Monte Station and Highland Park include Metro Lines 76, 78, 79, 258, 260, 266, 267, Metro Micro on-demand service as well as City of El Monte Commuter Shuttles nd Montebello Bus Lines 20 and 30.

Line Description: JPL - Pasadena (Caltech)
Details: Line 177 service is restarted for weekday peak periods between Pasadena (Caltech) and Jet Propulsion Laboratory. This service had been suspended in April 2020 due to the pandemic.

Line Description: Hollywood - Glendale - Pasadena via Los Feliz-Colorado
Details: Lines 180, 181 and 780 merged to become the new frequent Line 180, operating on the same route as discontinued Line 780 from Pasadena City College to Hollywood/Vine via Brand Bl rather than Central Av in downtown Glendale. Line 81 changes route via Yosemite Dr and Eagle Rock Bl to replace discontinued Line 181 segment. Pasadena Transit Line 20 and new Metro Line 662 replace Line 180 on Lake Av. Foothill Transit Line 187 replaces discontinued Line 181 service on Colorado Bl east of Pasadena City College.

Line Description: NorthEast LA - East Hollywood
Details: New Line 182 operates all-day 7-day a week service, from Rose Hill Transit Center to B Line (Red) Vermont/Sunset Station via Mercury Av, Griffin Av (replaces discontinued Line 252), Figueroa St, York Bl (replaces discontinued Line 83), Eagle Rock Bl, Fletcher Dr, Rowena Av, and Franklin St (replaces discontinued Line 175), to provide more direct east-west connection between Northeast LA and Hollywood while maintaining service between John Marshall High School and Vermont/Sunset Station.

Line Description: Sherman Oaks - Glendale via Magnolia Bl
Details: Line 183 is discontinued. Line 155 is extended from Sepulveda Bl via the Line 183 segment on Magnolia Bl to the B Line (Red) North Hollywood Station. Line 94 provides more frequency on the segment of Line 183 east of North Hollywood Station along Magnolia Bl to downtown Burbank. New Metro Micro (transit on-demand) service and existing Glendale Beeline 4 will be available in Glendale to replace the Line 183 segment on Chevy Chase/Acacia/Verdugo. Metro Micro will also serve the Bel Aire Dr/Kenneth Rd section of Line 183 in Burbank.

Line Description: Echo Park - Exposition Park via Alvarado St-Hoover St
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: Glendale - Koreatown via Silverlake Bl
Details: Line 201 is discontinued due to low ridership. Alternative services include Lines 92, 94, 180, 603, Glendale Beeline 4; new Metro Micro (transit on-demand) service will also be available along Chevy Chase in the Glendale area to include service to the Glendale Adventist Hospital.

Line Description: Willowbrook - Compton - Del Amo Station
Details: Line 202 is expanded to operate weekdays all day with new weekday off-peak service via existing route between the A Line (Blue) Del Amo Station and the C Line (Green)/A Line Willowbrook/Rosa Parks Station. The Line 202 segment south of the A Line Del Amo Station to Wilmington via Alameda St, Sanford St, and Anaheim St is discontinued due to low ridership. Alternative services in the area include Metro Lines 232 (Anaheim St), 246 (Avalon Bl), DASH Wilmington and Long Beach Transit Line 52 and Lines 191/192 south of A Line Del Amo Station.

Line Description: Hollywood - Athens via Vermont Av
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: Willowbrook Station - San Pedro via Wilmington Av-Vermont Av
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: Hollywood - Athens via Normandie Av
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: Hollywood - Athens via Western Av
Details: Line 207 operates more frequently and provides selected weekday trips extended to the C Line (Green) Crenshaw Station replacing Line 757. Bus stop consolidation.

Line Description: Expo/Crenshaw Station - Crenshaw C Line (Green) Station via Van Ness Av-Arlington Av
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: Hollywood/Vine Station - South Bay Galleria via Vine St, Wilshire/Western Station, Crenshaw Bl
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: Inglewood-South Bay Galleria via Prairie Av-Inglewood Av
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: Hollywood/Vine Station - Hawthorne/Lennox Station via La Brea Av
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: Hollywood/Vine Station - La Cienega Station via Hollywood Bl-Fairfax Av
Details: Line 217 operates more frequent service between La Cienega/Jefferson Station and Hollywood/Vine via Fairfax Av and Hollywood Bl. Line 217 also extends east via Hollywood Bl to Hollywood/Vermont helping to replace Line 780.

Line Description: Studio City - Cedars Sinai Medical Center via Laurel Canyon Bl-Fairfax Bl
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: Hollywood Burbank Airport - Hollywood via Hollywood Wy-Riverside Dr-Cahuenga Bl
Details: Line 222 operates on Hollywood Way and Riverside Dr between Hollywood Burbank Airport and B Line (Red) Universal City/Studio City Station, then serving Cahuenga Bl south to Hollywood. This replaces Line 237 service on Cahuenga Bl to Hollywood, but will no longer serve the low ridership Barham Bl segment. New Line 90 replaces Line 222 north of Hollywood Burbank Airport to Sunland.

Line Description: Sylmar Station - Universal City Station via San Fernando Rd-Lankershim Bl
Details: Line 224 operates frequent service along the existing route via Lankershim Bl and San Fernando Rd between B Line (Red) Universal City/Studio City Station, North Hollywood Station, and Sylmar/San Fernando Metrolink Station. New Line 690 replaces Line 224 between Sylmar/San Fernando Station and Olive View Medical Center.

Line Description: Mission College - Studio City via Laurel Canyon Bl
Details: Line 230 operates via existing route between Sylmar/San Fernando Metrolink Station and Studio City via Laurel Canyon Bl and Hubbard St, with weekday service extending to LA Mission College via Hubbard St.

Line Description: LAX City Bus Center - Long Beach - via Sepulveda Bl-Pacific Coast Hwy
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: Lake View Terrace - Sherman Oaks via Van Nuys Bl (+ Westside Owl service)
Details: Line 233 extends during overnight Owl hours 12am – 4am to the E Line (Expo) and Westside via Ventura and Sepulveda Blvds (in place of Line 234) when new Line 761 service is not operating.

Line Description: Mission College - Sylmar Station - Sherman Oaks via Sepulveda Bl
Details: Line 234 provides frequent service on Sepulveda Bl north of Ventura Bl to Sylmar/San Fernando Station (replacing Line 734), with selected trips extending to Mission College. Line 234 service south of Ventura Bl to the Westside and E Line (Expo) will be replaced by Line 761 daytime and evening hours seven days a week, and by Line 233 for overnight Owl service. Bus stop consolidation.

Line Description: Sylmar Station - Encino via Balboa Bl
Details: Line 236 operates via the existing route via Balboa Bl between Ventura Bl and Rinaldi St, then operates via the existing Line 239 route to Sylmar/San Fernando Metrolink Station. The existing segment of Line 236 north of Rinaldi St is discontinued due to low ridership.

Line Description: Encino-Granada Hill-Mission Hills-North Hollywood via White Oak Av-Woodley Av-Chandler
Details: Line 237 and 239 merge to become the new Line 237 between North Hollywood Station, Granada Hills, and Encino. Line 237 will follow its existing route from North Hollywood Station via Chandler Bl, Burbank Bl, Victory Bl, and Woodley Av to Rinaldi St, then a new route via Balboa Bl, Chatsworth St, and the existing Line 239 route via Zelzah Av, Lindley Av, Roscoe Bl, White Oak Av to Encino (Ventura Bl). B Line (Red) service replaces Line 237 service south of North Hollywood Station to Hollywood and Line 222 will also serve Cahuenga Bl between Universal City and Hollywood. Line 236 replaces Line 239 service between Balboa Bl and Sylmar/San Fernando Metrolink Station. New weekend service is added for Line 239 segment on Zelzah Av, Lindley Av, Roscoe Bl, White Oak Av to Encino (Ventura Bl).

Line Description: Sylmar Station - Encino via White Oak Av-Zelzah Av
Northridge - Universal City Station via Reseda Bl-Ventura Bl
Details: Lines 150, 240, 245, 744 and 750 merge to become two new lines: Line 150 operates from Ventura/Reseda west to Chatsworth Station along Ventura Bl and Topanga Canyon Bl; Line 240 operates via Reseda Bl and east along Ventura Bl between Northridge (Devonshire St), CSUN campus, and B Line (Red) Universal City/Studio City Station. New Line 150 replaces existing Line 245 on Topanga Canyon Bl while new Line 240 via Reseda and Ventura Blvds replaces Lines 150, 744 and 750 on Ventura Bl east of Ventura/Reseda and replaces Line 744 on Reseda Bl. Bus stop consolidation.

Line Description: Porter Ranch - Woodland Hills via Tampa Av-Winnetka Av
Details: No route changes. Restored Saturday service.

Line Description: Chatsworth Station - Ventura Bl via De Soto Av
Details:
Line 244 operates as a separate line (no longer linked to Line 245) via its existing route via De Soto Av between Chatsworth Station and Ventura Bl. New Line 150 replaces existing Lines 244 and 245, with service on Ventura Bl and Topanga Canyon Bl between Reseda Bl and Chatsworth Station. Line 244 will include new weekend service.

Line 245 is replaced by new Line 150 operating from Ventura/Reseda west to Chatsworth Station along Ventura Bl and Topanga Canyon Bl.

Line Description: San Pedro - Harbor Gateway Transit Center via Avalon Bl
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: Eagle Rock - Cypress Park - Long Beach Blvd C Line (Green) Station via Eagle Rock Bl-Soto St
Details: Line 251 extends trips every 30 minutes weekdays and weekends via the existing Line 28 on Cypress Av and Eagle Rock Bl to Eagle Rock (Colorado Bl/Eagledale)

Line Description: Lincoln Heights - Boyle Heights via Soto St
Details: Line 252 is discontinued due to low ridership. Alternative bus service includes Line 81 (Figueroa St), new Line 182 (Griffin Av/Broadway/Lincoln Park/Sierra/Mercury Av), Line 251 (Soto St) plus LADOT El Sereno/City Terrace DASH service.

Line Description: Commerce - Sierra Madre Villa Station via Eastern Ave-Ave 64-Washington Bl
Details: Line 256 between Commerce and Highland Park follows its existing route. The segment between Highland Park and Pasadena is changed to travel via Avenue 64, Colorado Bl, L Line (Gold) Memorial Park Station, Lincoln Av, Washington Bl, Altadena Dr and Foothill Bl to terminate service at the L Line (Gold) Sierra Madre Villa Station.

Line Description: Highland Park/South Pasadena - Paramount via Fremont Av-Eastern Av
Details: No route changes. New weekend service added.

Line Description: Altadena - Artesia Station via Fair Oaks Av-Atlantic Bl
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: Pasadena - Altadena - City of Hope - El Monte Station
Details: Line 264 is discontinued due to low ridership. New Metro Micro (transit on-demand) will provide alternate service in Altadena, Pasadena and Sierra Madre.  Service to the City of Hope Medical Center is provided by the L Line (Gold).

Line Description: Pico Rivera - Lakewood Center Mall via Paramount Bl
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: Sierra Madre Villa Station - Lakewood Center Mall via RosemeadBl
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: Pasadena - El Monte Station via Del Mar Bl & Temple City Bl
Details: Line 267 is shortened to operate via existing route between El Monte Station, Arcadia and Pasadena via Temple City Bl, Rosemead Bl and Del Mar Bl, ending at the L Line (Gold) Del Mar Station. New Line 256 operates via the south end of Lincoln Av, and new Line 662 operates in both directions on a loop route via Lake Av, Altadena Dr, Lincoln Av, Washington Bl, and Los Robles Av between Pasadena (L Line [Gold] Del Mar and Lake Stations) and Altadena weekdays and weekends. New Metro Micro (transit on-demand) service will be available in Sierra Madre, Altadena, JPL and Pasadena.

Line Description: Sierra Madre Villa Station - El Monte Station via Baldwin Av
Details: Line 268 is shortened to operate from the El Monte Station to the L Line (Gold) Sierra Madre Villa Station, providing direct service along Foothill Bl and no longer travels along Sierra Madre Bl via Baldwin Av and Michillinda Av. New Line 256 will serve Washington Bl/Lincoln Av. New Metro Micro (transit on-demand) service will provide alternative service in Sierra Madre, Altadena and Pasadena, as well as to JPL.

Line Description: El Monte Station - Arcadia Station via Santa Anita Av
Details: New Line 287 replaces Line 487 between El Monte Station and Arcadia Station via Santa Anita Av, with weekday and weekend service. On weekdays only, Line 287 extends from El Monte Station to The Shops at Montebello via the existing Line 176 route.

Line Description: Burbank Station - Sylmar Station via San Fernando Rd
Details: New Line 294 is added, operating on San Fernando Rd between Sylmar/San Fernando Metrolink Station and downtown Burbank in place of existing Lines 94 and 794.

Line Description: Harbor Gateway Transit Center - Palos Verdes via Hawthorne Bl
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: Downtown LA - Disneyland via Harbor Transitway-105 Freeway-Norwalk C Line (Green) Station
Details: No route changes. Bus stop consolidation.

Line Description: Downtown LA - Sierra Madre Villa Station
Details:
Line 487 begins service at L Line (Gold) Sierra Madre Villa Station operating via San Gabriel Bl, Las Tunas Dr, Mission Dr, Del Mar Av, I-10 Express Lanes to 7th St Metro Center in downtown LA during weekday peak hours and LA Union Station off-peak weekdays and all day weekends. The Line 487 segment in Sierra Madre is replaced with new Metro Micro (transit on-demand) service serving Sierra Madre, Pasadena and Altadena. New Line 287 replaces Line 487 between El Monte Station and Arcadia Station via Santa Anita Av, with weekday and weekend service.
No route changes to Line 489.

Line Description: North Hollywood - Pasadena Express
Details: Line 501 continues to link North Hollywood, Burbank, Glendale and Pasadena, with a new routing serving downtown Glendale via Brand Bl and Broadway.

Line Description: Malibu - Santa Monica
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: Jefferson Park - San Pedro via Harbor Transitway
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: El Monte Station - Long Beach VA Medical Center via I-605 Freeway
Details: Line 577 between El Monte Station and Cal State Long Beach via I-605 route change between El Monte Station and Rio Hondo College via I-605 and I-10 freeways instead of Santa Anita Av & Peck Rd, providing faster, more direct service. Service to Los Cerritos Center is discontinued due to low ridership, providing faster, more direct service to/from Cal State Long Beach and Long Beach VA Medical Center.

Line Description: Warner Center Circulator
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: Westwood - Pacific Palisades via Sunset Bl
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: Glendale - Grand Station via San Fernando Rd-Rampart St-Hoover St
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: LAC+USC Medical Center - Boyle Heights Shuttle
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: Huntington Park Shuttle
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: Beverly Dr-Burton Wy-Robertson Bl Shuttle
Details: New Line 617 operates from the E Line (Expo) Culver City Station to Cedars-Sinai Medical Center/Beverly Center via Robertson Bl (replacing Line 17), then west on Burton Way (replacing Line 16), and south on Beverly Dr to Pico Bl (replacing Line 14). New weekend service for Robertson Bl.

Line Description: Mission Hills-Hollywood Owl via Woodley-Chandler-Cahuenga
Details: No route changes to Line 656 overnight Owl service.

Line Description: Altadena-Pasadena Shuttle
Details: New Line 662 operates in both directions on a loop route via Lake Av, Altadena Dr, Lincoln Av, Washington Bl, and Los Robles Av between Pasadena (L Line [Gold] Del Mar and Lake Stations) and Altadena weekdays and weekends, replacing Line 687 and parts of Lines 180, 267, and 268.

Line Description: Cal State LA - City Terrace Shuttle
Details: No route changes. Line 665 continues to link Cal State LA and Indiana/Olympic with weekday 5:30am and Saturday 6am service start times restored.

Line Description: Glendale College - Glassell Park via Verdugo Rd
Details: Line 685 is discontinued due to low ridership. Alternative bus service to Glendale College provided by Line 90 (Glendale Av), as well as new Metro Micro (transit on-demand) service in the Glendale, Eagle Rock and Highland Park areas.

Line Description: Altadena - Pasadena via Allen Av
Details:
Line 686 continues to operate between Altadena (New York Dr/Allen Av) and L Line (Gold) Del Mar Station, but no longer extends south to the L Line (Gold) Fillmore Station due to low ridership. 
Line 687 is discontinued due to low ridership. Alternative bus service includes frequent Lines 260 (Fair Oaks Av), new Line 662 (Washington Bl, Los Robles Av and Lake Av), and new Metro Micro (transit on-demand) service in Altadena and Pasadena.

Line Description: Sunland-Sylmar
Details: New Line 690 operates between Sunland and Olive View Medical Center via Foothill Bl, replacing Lines 90/91, and continuing along Roxford St and San Fernando Rd to Sylmar/San Fernando Metrolink Station, replacing Line 224.

Line Description: Downtown LA - Santa Monica via Santa Monica Bl
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: Santa Monica - Downtown LA via Wilshire Bl
Details: Line 720 continues to operate between downtown LA (6th & Central) and Westwood/Santa Monica via its existing alignment on Wilshire Bl. Line 720 east of downtown LA is replaced by Line 18 increased service on Whittier Bl between downtown LA and Commerce Center.

Line Description: Downtown LA - Santa Monica via Venice Bl
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: Sylmar - West Los Angeles via Sepulveda Bl
Details: Line 734 is discontinued, replaced by Line 234 increased service on Sepulveda Bl in the San Fernando Valley as well as new Line 761 linking the San Fernando Valley and the Westside and E Line (Expo).

Line Description: Northridge - Pacoima via Van Nuys-Ventura-Reseda Bl
Details: Line 744 is discontinued, replaced by Line 240 increased service on Reseda and Ventura Bl, and Line 233 increased service plus new Line 761 on Van Nuys Bl.

Line Description: Warner Center - Universal/Studio City via Ventura Bl
Details: Lines 150, 240, 245, 744 and 750 merge to become two new lines: Line 150 operates from Ventura/Reseda west to Chatsworth Station along Ventura Bl and Topanga Canyon Bl; Line 240 operates via Reseda Bl and east along Ventura Bl between Northridge (Devonshire St), CSUN campus, and B Line (Red) Universal City Station. New Line 150 replaces existing Line 245 on Topanga Canyon Bl while new Line 240 via Reseda and Ventura Bl replace Lines 150, 744 and 750 on Ventura Bl east of Ventura/Reseda and replace Line 744 on Reseda Bl.

Line Description: Hollywood - Athens via Vermont Ave
Details: No route changes.

Line Description: Hollywood - Crenshaw Station via Western Ave
Details: Line 757 weekday service is discontinued and replaced by Line 207 more frequent service on Western Av, with selected Line 207 trips extended to C Line (Green) Crenshaw Station.

Line Description: Sylmar Station - Westside/Expo Line via Van Nuys Bl-Sepulveda Bl
Details: New Line 761 replaces existing Lines 734, 744 and 788, operating between Sylmar/San Fernando Metrolink Station and E Line (Expo) Expo/Sepulveda Station, to serve high travel demand between San Fernando Valley and the Westside, via Van Nuys Bl, Ventura Bl and Sepulveda Bl, including frequent service all day on weekdays and weekends.

Line Description: Downtown LA - El Monte Station via Garvey Av-Atlantic Bl-Cesar Chavez Av
Details: Line 770 is discontinued, and replaced by frequent Line 70, rerouted via Garvey Av, Atlantic Bl and Cesar Chavez Av between El Monte Station and downtown LA.

Line Description: Pasadena - Washington/Fairfax via Colorado Bl-Hollywood Bl-Fairfax Av
Details: Line 780 is discontinued, replaced by Line 180 more frequent service between Pasadena City College and Hollywood/Vine as well as Line 217 more frequent service on Hollywood Bl and Fairfax Av to the E Line (Expo), and extended east along Hollywood Bl from Hollywood/Vine to Vermont/Sunset.

Line Description: Van Nuys Bl - Westside
Details: Line 788, which has not operated since mid-2020, will be permanently discontinued, replaced by new Line 761 service between Sylmar/San Fernando Metrolink Station, Van Nuys Bl, the Westside and E Line (Expo) Expo/Sepulveda Station, with seven-day service.

Line Description: Chatsworth - Canoga Park - North Hollywood
Details: No route changes to G Line (Orange) route. This line is now fully operated by battery electric buses.

Line Description: San Pedro - Harbor Gateway Tranist Center - Downtown LA - El Monte Station
Details: No route changes.
